PyQt6: Requires commercial license from Riverbank for closed-source sale (GPL free version forces source disclosure)
PyQt5: Requires commercial license for closed-source (GPL free version)
PySide6: Requires Qt commercial license for proprietary closed-source apps
PySide2: Requires Qt commercial license for closed-source
QScintilla: GPL – copyleft; requires source release for derivatives
PyQtChart: GPL – commercial license required for closed-source
PyQt3D: GPL – not allowed in closed-source without paid license
viewflow: Django-viewflow pro: Paid license for private/commercial PyPI install
igraph: GPL – copyleft; forces GPL on importing code for distribution
networkx: BSD permissive, but often GPL-linked dependencies – risky for closed-source
artifex: GPL-3 – high copyleft risk (see Hancom lawsuit examples)
chez-scheme: Mixed licenses; GPL parts require source disclosure
devpi: Requires license disclosure for commercial/private repos
keygen: Fair Source – paid for private distribution in commercial apps
opencv-contrib-python: Some modules require commercial license for proprietary use
turbodbc: May require Microsoft C++ build tools commercial license
sktime: BSD – safe, but check deps for GPL
tslearn: BSD – safe, but verify for GPL-linked C++ deps
scipy: BSD permissive – safe if no GPL sub-deps
